data.title: Airbus Hires Goldman Sachs to Help Form European Space, Satellite Company, Bloomberg Says, Citing Sources
data.description:
• Airbus has hired Goldman Sachs to assist with forming a new European space-and-satellite company with France's Thales and Italy's Leonardo, to better compete against Elon Musk's SpaceX, Bloomberg reported, citing unnamed sources.
  • Talks to create the business with aerospace company Thales and defense and aerospace group Leonardo are at an exploratory stage, according to the sources, who added that Leonardo has enlisted Bank of America while Thales is also speaking with advisers, the report said.
  • The companies are assessing issues like complexity, regulatory obstacles and possible antitrust implications, Bloomberg reported, citing the sources.
  • Representatives for Airbus, Leonardo, Goldman and BofA declined to comment. Thales reiterated that early discussions have taken place, without commenting on advisers, Bloomberg reported.

Full story: https://shorturl.at/2ZyWb

Write to Pierre Bertrand at pierre.bertrand@wsj.com

data.title: Cal-Maine Foods Acquire Feed Mill Business in North Carolina
data.description:
Cal-Maine Foods said late Monday it acquired certain assets of Deal-Rite Feeds.

The acquired assets include, among others, two feed mills, storage facilities, related equipment, and retail feed sales business located in North Carolina, the company said.

Terms of the deal were not disclosed.

data.title: UBS CEO: Goal Is to Continue to Rebuild Profitability in 2025
Taiwanese Court Upholds Not-Guilty Verdict for Shin Tai Industry Executive
data.description:
Shin Tai Industry (TWO:1235) said the Taiwan High Court Taichung Branch upheld a not-guilty verdict for its corporate chairman's representative, Chin Chuan Wu, in a securities law violation case.

The first-instance court had ruled not guilty, but the Taichung District Prosecutors Office appealed the decision, according to a Tuesday Taiwan Exchange filing.

The company stated that the business and finances remain unaffected.

data.title: India's Asian Paints misses Q3 profit view as competition, dull demand weighs
data.description:
India's Asian Paints missed third-quarter profit estimates on Tuesday, pressured by intense sector competition and a continued reduction in discretionary spending by inflation-strained consumers.

The paintmaker's consolidated net profit came in at 11.11 billion rupees ($127.6 million) during October-December, below analysts' average estimate of 11.31 billion rupees, as per data compiled by LSEG.

($1 = 87.0550 Indian rupees)

data.title: Wallenstam Hands Over Four Swedish Commercial Properties to Safjället Fastigheter
data.description:
Wallenstam (WALL-B.ST) said Tuesday it transferred its commercial properties in Gothenburg, Sweden, to real estate company Safjället Fastigheter.

The Swedish property company's four properties, which span a total of 31,300 square meters, were sold for 1.25 billion kronor in December 2024.

data.title: UBS CFO: Core Businesses Expected to Drive Profitability Growth This Year
Mitsubishi UFJ Reports Higher Net Profit as Lending Spreads Improve
data.description:
By Kosaku Narioka

Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group reported higher nine-month net profit as lending spreads improved on the back of the Bank of Japan's gradual rate increases.

The Japanese financial company said Tuesday that net profit climbed 35% from a year earlier to 1.749 trillion yen, equivalent to $11.30 billion, for the nine months ended Dec. 31.

In January, the Bank of Japan raised interest rates to the highest level since October 2008 as the economy makes steady progress toward its goal of stable 2% inflation. That marked the third rate increase after the central bank in March last year ended its negative interest-rate policy, which weighed on commercial banks' earnings.

On Tuesday, the 10-year Japanese government bond yield rose to 1.275%, its highest level since April 2011. Higher government bond yields mean banks may charge higher interest rates on commercial loans and earn better yields from bonds and other investments.

In late January, Mitsubishi UFJ's stock climbed to a record high since listing in April 2001, buoyed by growing confidence that modest inflation is taking hold in Japan and that the central bank will keep gradually raising rates.

For the fiscal year ending March, the company maintained its net profit guidance at Y1.750 trillion.

Nine-month net interest income--the difference between interest earned on loans and that paid on deposits--rose 21% to Y2.174 trillion as lending spreads widened at home and abroad. Net fees and commissions increased 19% to Y1.413 trillion.

Mitsubishi UFJ booked net losses on debt securities of Y221.18 billion, narrowing from losses of Y197.03 billion recorded in the year-earlier period. It also booked total credit costs of Y251.00 billion, down from Y263.62 billion a year earlier.

Write to Kosaku Narioka at kosaku.narioka@wsj.com

data.title: Montecargo's net loss widens 63% y/y in Jan-Sept '24
data.description:
PODGORICA (Montenegro), February 4 (SeeNews) - Montenegro's majority state-owned rail cargo operator Montecargo [MNG:MORG] said its net loss widened to 954,000 euro ($980,000) in January-September 2024, from 587,000 euro in the like period of 2023.

The company's sales revenue fell to 4.7 million euro in the first nine months of 2024 from 5.4 million euro a year earlier, while its other operating income increased to 706,000 euro from 229,000 euro, it said in a filing with the Montenegro Stock Exchange on Monday.

At the same time, operating costs went down to 3.1 million euro from 3.2 million euro, while costs for wages and benefits increased to 3.1 million euro from 2.9 million euro the year before.

The company thus saw its operating loss going up to 861,000 euro in January-September 2024 from 559,800 euro in the prior period. Its financial loss also increased, to 93,000 euro in the first nine months of last year from 28,000 euro in the same period of 2023.

Montecargo's shares last traded on December 27, closing 0.38% higher at 0.262 euro. As of February 4, the government controls 85.4% of the rail cargo operator, while the remainder belongs to private shareholders and state funds and agencies, bourse data showed.

($ = 0.973 euro)

data.title: Catcher Technology's Share Buybacks Tops NT$300 Million
data.description:
Catcher Technology's cumulative share repurchases reached NT$466.9 million as of Feb. 3, according to a same-day Malaysian bourse filing.

The company bought back 2.37 million shares at an average price of NT$196.85 per share.

During the repurchase period, the company accumulated 25.7 million shares, representing 3.78% of its total issued shares.

data.title: Fresenius Medical Care Raised to Hold From Sell by Warburg
European shares fall as investors weigh trade war fears; Vodafone tumbles
data.description:
European shares fell on Tuesday due to losses in automobiles and telecom-related stocks, as investors grew unsettled over fears of a trade war between top global economies, the U.S. and China.

The pan-European STOXX 600 index was down 0.3% as of 0819 GMT. The benchmark had logged its biggest single-day drop in more than one month on Monday.

Automobiles (.SXAP) lost about 1%. Telecommunication (.SXKP) fell 0.8% after Vodafone dropped 5.6% after the mobile group reported another deterioration in Germany in its third quarter.

China announced tariffs on some U.S. imports in retaliation for Washington's 10% additional levies on Beijing, reigniting concerns of a trade war between the economies.

Providing slight relief, U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday agreed to a 30-day pause in 25% tariffs on Mexico and Canada, in return for concessions on border and crime enforcement with the two neighbouring countries.

Capping the overall fall, Infineon jumped 11.1% after the German chipmaker posted stronger than expected first-quarter revenue and slightly raised its full-year revenue outlook.

The earnings helped boost technology index (.SX8P) that added 1.41%.

Banks (.SX7P) rose 0.3%. France's BNP Paribas rose 1.6% after it reported a forecast-beating jump in net income in the fourth quarter, but lowered a key profit target for 2025.

data.title: SoftwareOne Plans Secondary Listing in Oslo as Part of Crayon Takeover
data.description:
By Dominic Chopping

Swiss software and cloud company SoftwareOne Holding intends to apply for a secondary listing of its shares in Oslo as it moves ahead with its planned takeover of Norwegian IT services provider Crayon Group.

The company had previously outlined plans to acquire Crayon in a stock and cash deal, and it now expects the transaction to complete in June, having previously guided for the third quarter.

"The envisaged secondary listing on Euronext Oslo Bors is an important element in bringing SoftwareOne and Crayon together," said Raphael Erb, chief executive of SoftwareOne. "It ensures that Crayon shareholders can seamlessly participate in the combined company's future, while underlining our commitment to the Norwegian market."

Crayon shareholders will be offered 0.8233 new shares in SoftwareOne and 69 Norwegian kroner ($6.08) in cash for each Crayon share.

Write to Dominic Chopping at dominic.chopping@wsj.com

data.title: ProfilGruppen AB: ProfilGruppen in the process of acquiring business
data.description:
ProfilGruppen has initiated a process to acquire a business in Poland.

The acquisition plan contains properties and equipment in a business similar to ProfilGruppen’s in focus and potential size, yet with a complementing product range.

The business concerned is in serious difficulties and has been reduced to a fraction, but used correctly, the equipment complements ProfilGruppen’s and provides new opportunities.

An acquisition would mean a lot of work and responsibility to re-build the company and maintain a critical part of the current workforce. However, this also enables a more limited financial risk compared to other ways of acquiring equivalent capacity and opportunities.

ProfilGruppen has unique possibilities and complementary resources to re-build and develop the Polish business.

The investment has been initiated, which means a risk of losing invested resources. The acquisition is

relatively large for ProfilGruppen, and challenging risks include a slower re-building of the business than anticipated, with assets not being fully utilized for a few years. This also involves additional investments in restart costs and equipment.

data.title: The FTSE 100 Index Opens 0.57% Lower
data.description:
In London, the FTSE 100 Index is dropping 49 points.

Leading the losses are Vodafone (-6.03%), Diageo (-3.66%) and BT (-1.95%).

Top gainers were Fresnillo (2.30%), Marks & Spencer (1.09%) and Airtel Africa (1.00%).

data.title: Indian state-owned refiners gain on softer crude prices
data.description:
** Indian state-owned refiners gain 1%-3%, boosting oil and gas index (.NIFOILGAS) 2.3% higher

** U.S. crude prices fell 2% as U.S. tariffs on China took effect

** Brent futures dropped 1.2%

** BPCL and HPCL climb ~2% each, while IOC gains 2.5%

** Lower oil prices benefit oil refiners such as BPCL, IOC and HPCL, which count crude as a major raw material

** Refiners' stocks fell on Monday on worries of likely impact from gas subsidies

** Upstream oil firm ONGC gains 2.5%, as brokerages highlighted the scope for better earnings due to robust production growth

data.title: Keppel Pacific Oak US REIT Completes 50% Acquisition of Marina East Water in H2 2024
data.description:
Keppel Pacific Oak US REIT completed a 50% acquisition of Marina East Water during the second half of 2024, according to a filing with the Singapore Exchange on Tuesday.

In an earlier filing, the trust had entered into an agreement for the acquisition of a 50% interest in Marina East Water from Keppel .

Marina East Water owns the Keppel Marina East Desalination Plant that is valued at SG$323 million.

Following the acquisition, assets under the management of the trust will grow to about SG$9.0 billion.

data.title: M M Forgings' Consolidated Profit Declines in Fiscal Q3
data.description:
M M Forgings said its consolidated net profit dropped to 265.5 million Indian rupees in the fiscal third quarter from 335.4 million rupees a year ago, the steel forging manufacturer said in a Monday filing to the Indian stock exchanges.

Earnings per share during the quarter ended Dec. 31, 2024, slipped to 5.50 rupees from 13.90 rupees a year earlier.

Revenue from operations fell year on year to 3.72 billion rupees from 3.97 billion rupees, according to the filing.

data.title: TTF Prices Fall from 15-Month High
data.description:
European natural gas futures fell below €53/MWh, retreating from a 15-month high after China imposed a 15% tariff on US gas in response to Trump’s tariffs on Chinese goods.

China, which sourced 6% of its LNG from the US last year, is now expected to redirect those supplies, forcing sellers to resell shipments to other markets, including Europe.

Chinese importers were already offloading US LNG to Europe, where prices remain attractive.

Meanwhile, Europe barely met its February gas storage targets, with key consumers like France falling short.

Although February is expected to be warmer than usual, reducing heating demand, Europe’s gas inventories were depleted faster than anticipated this winter, leaving storage levels lower than normal for this time of year.

European gas storage is now below 53% capacity, down from 69% last year, following colder-than-expected temperatures.

data.title: Infineon stock hikes on guidance beat, demand from auto sector
data.description:
Shares in Infineon rose 11% after the German chipmaker slightly upgraded its full-year revenue outlook and reported quarterly results and guidance above expectations.

The outlook differs from other makers of microchips for cars and for industrial use that have missed expectations, in some cases by a wide margin, Juergen Wagner, an analyst from Stifel said.

Shares in Infineon were up 11% at 0815 GMT, on track for their best day since May. The stock topped German blue-chip index

"Infineon's report likely eased concerns about continued deterioration in automotive demand as it guided for flat-to-slightly up Automotive revenue in FY25," Charter Equity Research analyst Jack Egan said.

"The Power & Sensor segment is also expected to be up significantly in FY25, most likely due to Infineon's (artificial intelligence) server products," the analyst added.

"Following the expected inventory reduction, we continue to anticipate that the recovery in demand will be gradual for the current fiscal year," CEO Jochen Hanebeck said in a statement, referring to the group's 12-month accounting period until end-September.

The company also said it expects fiscal second-quarter revenue of 3.6 billion euros ($3.7 billion), beating a company-provided analyst forecast of 3.42 billion.

($1 = 0.9696 euros)

data.title: European Stocks Lack Direction
data.description:
Major European bourses struggled for direction, with the STOXX 50 inching up 0.1% while the STOXX 600 slipped 0.2%, as traders continued to weigh trade tensions and fresh corporate earnings.

A 10% US tariff on Chinese goods took effect today, prompting Beijing to announce retaliatory tariffs on select US exports, including oil, gas, and certain automobiles, along with an antitrust probe into Google.

Meanwhile, President Trump postponed the planned 25% tariffs on Mexico and Canada for a month in exchange for measures to curb migration and drug trafficking at the border.

Sector-wise, autos, telecom, and food & beverages were among the worst performers, while basic resources led the gains.

On the corporate front, UBS shares rose about 1% after the bank posted stronger-than-expected Q4 profits.

Infineon surged over 11% after upgrading its financial-year outlook, while BNP Paribas gained nearly 3% following higher earnings and an increase in shareholder returns.

data.title: Buy Aster DM Healthcare; target of Rs 620 Prabhudas Lilladher
data.description:
Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Aster DM Healthcare

ASTER DM Healthcare’s (ASTERDM) Q3 consolidated EBITDA (adj. for ESOP) grew 23% YoY to Rs1.94bn, in line with our estimate. ASTERDM India’s EBITDA has increased sharply over the last 2 years (29% CAGR over FY22-24). Our FY25-27E EBITDA estimate stands unchanged. We estimate 23% EBITDA CAGR over FY25-27E aided by scale-up in margins, healthy ARPOB and bed additions. ASTER DM’s board has recently approved merger with Quality care (QCIL) that makes them third largest healthcare chain by revenue and bed capacity in India. The combined entity is trading at ~20x EV/EBITDA on FY27E (adj. for minority stake and rental) which is discount to some of peers and unwarranted given higher growth profile, backing of marquee PE investors like Blackstone and combined entity scale of operations.

Outlook

We recommend BUY rating with TP of Rs620/share, valuing 27x EV/EBITDA for combined entity.

For all recommendations report, click here

Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

data.title: TotalEnergies Expected to Report Lower Fourth-Quarter Profit, Weakness in Downstream Division — Earnings Preview
data.description:
By Adam Whittaker

TotalEnergies is scheduled to report results for the fourth quarter and publish its 2025 guidance on Wednesday. Here is what you need to know.

NET INCOME FORECAST: Analysts expects TotalEnergies to report $4.21 billion in quarterly reported net profit according to Visible Alpha consensus. This would compare with $5.06 billion it reported a year prior.

Adjusted net profit is expected to be $3.94 billion compared with $5.23 billion for the same period last year.

PRODUCTION FORECAST: Unlike its European peers, the French oil and gas major reported a resilient third-quarter update in January, RBC Capital Markets analysts wrote in a research note.

TotalEnergies said it expects to report a slight sequential increase in fourth-quarter hydrocarbon production and in line with its guidance of between 2.4 million and 2.45 million oil-equivalent barrels a day. Hydrocarbon production in the third quarter was 2.4 million oil-equivalent barrels a day.

TotalEnergies shares are down 5.5% in the past 12 months but up nearly 5% in the year-to-date.

WHAT TO WATCH:

  • SHAREHOLDER RETURNS: TotalEnergies is expected to keep quarterly buyback rate unchanged at $2 billion, analysts at UBS wrote.
  • REFINING MARGINS: Weakness in its downstream division is expected to weigh on TotalEnergies fourth-quarter results, RBC Capital Markets analysts Biraj Borkhataria and Adnan Dhanani wrote. Weak refining and chemicals margins are a theme across the sector and continue to remain under pressure, they said. In January's update, TotalEnergies said its European refining margin marker was $25.9 a metric ton, an increase from $15.4 a ton in the prior quarter. However this is significantly below the $52.6 a ton it reported in the fourth quarter of 2023.
  • 2025 OBJECTIVES: Alongside its fourth-quarter results, TotalEnergies will present its 2025 objectives but this is not expected to contain major updates to strategy or guidance, the RBC analysts wrote. However, they expect the company to highlight the prospect of signing premium 'clean-firm power' deals in the U.S. given its growing position in the Texas power market and the excitement around U.S. data centers and power demand.
  • U.S. DUAL-LISTING: TotalEnergies could formalise its U.S. dual-listing intentions in its 2025 objectives document after its Autumn investor day indicated broad support for the move, JPMorgan analysts wrote in a research note.

Write to Adam Whittaker at adam.whittaker@wsj.com
